chargeHist.descr: Retail Theft - Failure to Pay for Service (>$500 - $5000)
Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel Richard Pruden is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Megan E. Kelly Daniel Richard Pruden pro se. Includes  13CF205, 14CF103, 15CF288. Court reviews files and letter from DE and DE mother. Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Daniel P Repka DF: Daniel Richard Pruden appeared. Case called at 2:04. Includes 14CF103, 13CF205, 15CF288, 14CF507. Court reviews error in the PSI regarding what should have been misdemeanor theft. ADA Hartung updates the court and responds to the PSI. Atty. Repka gives sentencing recommendatons. DE makes statement. Court orders: Sentence W/H 
On 14CF103
4 years probation with conditions
6 months condition time 3 months STAYED time to be served 30 days each year during the first 3 years of probation
   commencing the first 120 days of probation.
- Costs of $268.00
- DE to complete any additional programming as agent deems necessary.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- DE to maintain employment.
- DE to obtain GED or HSED.
- DE to have have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Carley and Carol Sarafin or their residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
- 40 hours community service. 

On 14CF507 Sentence W/H
Ct. 2
4 years probation with conditions sames as 14CF103 
Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation. 
Probation is concurrent to 14CF103
- Costs of $268.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Ct. 3 
1 years probation with conditions concurrent to 14CF507 Ct. 2
Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation. 
- Costs of 243.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
- restitution of $89.49 to Walmart

On 13CF205
- restitution of $1675.35 joint and several with C. Eggum

On 15CF288
- restitution of $814.93 to Hudson Chrysler


Cash to be applied remainder to be paid during probation.
DE to report to probation today. 
Atty's to have 10 days to obtain credit against an ultimate sentence.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  Daniel P Repka   DF:  Daniel Richard Pruden appeared by pnone. Case called at 10:51. Includes 14CF103, 14CF507 open files and 13CF205, 15CF288 read ins for restitution. Court addresses DE and Atty. Repka about completing PSI. Atty. Repka responds. Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Daniel P Repka DF:  Daniel Richard Pruden appeared. Case called at 8:16. 13CF205, 14CF103, 14CF507, 15CF288. ADA Hartung updates the court. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 2 and 3 in 14CF507 and 14CF103. In 14CF507 Ct. 3, Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony. Court acknowledges the plea to Ct. 3. DE acknowledges the theft charges in 13CF205 and 15CF288 and accepts responsibility for the theft charges. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 and 3 in 14CF507 and guilty of 14CF103. On motion of the State without objection, Crt reads in and dismisses 13CF205 for purposes of restitution, Ct. 1 of 15CF288 for purposes of restitution and out right dismisses Ct. 2-6 in 15CF288 and Ct. 1 in 14CF507. Court orders a PSI completed within the next 60 days. Bond continues. Monies to be moved to the files for restitution and costs. On  13CF205- Restitution will be joint and several with C. Eggum 14CF302.   Address confirmed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
Filed by ADA Hartung. Requesting a plea date. km

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Matthew L. Hartung,  DF ATTY:  Daniel P Repka, DF:  Daniel Richard Pruden appeared.  Court called at 9:22 a.m.  Set for Preliminary Hearing.  S/T of Officer Edward Rankin of the Hudson Police Department.  Direct by ADA Matthew Hartung.  DE is identified by Officer Rankin.  Cross by Attorney Repka.  Witness is excused.  Arguments by attorneys.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was probably was committed and that the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  Bail is continued.  Set out for arraignment.  Court adjourned at 9:34 a.m. lw  Arraignment scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Saundra Hanson  15R 009414. eif
Appointing Atty Repka. km
Preliminary hearing on July 1, 2015 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 24, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Luther Chrysler Dealership in Hudson WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
